summary: A Definitive Guide to Building Desktop, Mobile, and Embedded Java Clients
description: Use the JavaFX platform to create rich-client Java applications and discover how you can use this powerful Java-based UI platform, which is capable of handling large-scale data-driven business applications for PC as well as mobile and embedded devices.
authors: Johan Vos, Stephen Chin, Weiqi Gao, James Weaver, Dean Iverson
name: Pro JavaFX 9
subtitle: A Definitive Guide to Building Desktop, Mobile, and Embedded Java Clients

summary: Rich Client Applications for any Platform
description: Create media-rich client applications using JavaFX 9 and the Java 9 platform. Learn to create GUI-based applications for mobile devices, desktop PCs, and even the web. Incorporate media such as audio and video into your applications.
authors: Carl Dea, Mark Heckler, Gerrit Grunwald, José Pereda, Sean Phillips
name: JavaFX 9 by Example
subtitle: Rich Client Applications for any Platform

description: Use Java 9 and JavaFX 9 to write 3D games for the latest consumer electronics devices. Written by open source gaming expert Wallace Jackson, this book uses Java 9 and NetBeans 9 to add leading-edge features, such as 3D, textures, animation, digital audio, and digital image compositing to your games.
name: Pro Java 9 Games Development
subtitle: Leveraging the JavaFX APIs

summary: Learn the power and fun of experimenting with electronics
description: Get started with the latest versions of Java, JavaFX, Pi4J, Spring and so much more. Learn the power (and fun!) of experimenting with electronics. All explained in many small and easy to understand examples.
name: Getting Started with Java on the Raspberry Pi
subtitle: Learn the power and fun of experimenting with electronics

summary: Build advanced and visually stunning Java applications
description: Leverage advanced GUI programming techniques using the latest JavaFX 10 framework. Create dynamic content using the animation API and work with different application layers. Create and customize plugins and use them efficiently in different applications.
name: Mastering JavaFX 10
subtitle: Build advanced and visually stunning Java applications

summary: Create amazing Java GUI applications with this hands-on, fast-paced guide
description: JavaFX Essentials will help you to design and build high performance JavaFX 8-based applications that run on a variety of devices.
name: JavaFX Essentials
subtitle: Create amazing Java GUI applications with this hands-on, fast-paced guide

summary: Building User Experience and Interfaces with Java 8
description: Learn JavaFX 8 shows you how to start developing rich-client desktop applications using your Java skills and provides comprehensive coverage of JavaFX 8's features. Each chapter starts with an introduction to the topic at hand, followed by a step-by-step discussion of the topic with small snippets of code.
name: Learn JavaFX 8
subtitle: Building User Experience and Interfaces with Java 8

summary: A Fast-Paced Guide to JavaFX GUI Programming Fundamentals
description: Introducing JavaFX 8 Programming provides a fast-paced, practical introduction to JavaFX, Java's next-generation GUI programming framework. In this easy-to-read guide, best-selling author Herb Schildt presents the key topics and concepts you'll need to start developing modern, dynamic JavaFX GUI applications.
name: Introducing JavaFX 8 Programming
subtitle: A Fast-Paced Guide to JavaFX GUI Programming Fundamentals

summary: Create Custom JavaFX 8 Controls for Cross-Platform Applications
description: Deliver state-of-the-art applications with visually stunning UIs. Mastering JavaFX 8 Controls provides clear instructions, detailed examples, and ready-to-use code samples.
name: Mastering JavaFX 8 Controls
subtitle: Create Custom JavaFX 8 Controls for Cross-Platform Applications

summary: Unleash the power of JavaFX for a wide range of devices
description: This accessible book highlights the most important features of the powerful JavaFX graphics platform, giving you the tools to understand it quickly and easily.
name: JavaFX For Dummies
subtitle: Unleash the power of JavaFX for a wide range of devices

description: This book is a reference for building Java applications for desktop, mobile and embedded.
authors: Stefen Chin, Johan Vos and James Weaver
name: The Definitive Guide to Modern Java Clients with JavaFX 17
subtitle: Cross-Platform Mobile and Cloud Development

summary: Building User Experience and Interfaces with Java
description: This book is a reference for building Java applications for desktop, mobile and embedded.
name: Learn JavaFX 17
subtitle: Building User Experience and Interfaces with Java

summary: Real-world game development concepts using JavaFX and FXGL.
description: Understand real-world game development concepts using JavaFX game engine called FXGL.
name: Learn JavaFX Game and App Development
subtitle: With FXGL 17

summary: Build elegant, responsive, and stable Java Virtual Machine-based client applications (Fat Clients) with modern user interfaces.
description: This book introduces JavaFX as a frontend technology and utilizes Kotlin instead of Java for coding program artifacts to boost code expressiveness and maintainability.
name: Frontend Development with JavaFX and Kotlin
subtitle: Build State-of-the-Art Kotlin GUI Applications
